sentence.Network_en: I was stimulated to examine my deepest thoughts.
sentence.Network_cn: 我深受启发，开始审视自己内心深处的想法。

sentence.Network_en: He is a villain of the deepest dye.
sentence.Network_cn: 他是个穷凶极恶的恶棍.

sentence.Network_en: The discussion sessions allow people to open the floodgates to their deepest fears.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些讨论会使人们尽情倾诉心中的恐惧.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 计算机相关英语词汇(2) ... decomposition 分解 deepest 最深的 default 默认.
your laws ignore our deepest needs., 你的法律忽视了我们最深的需要.
Frustration is implicit in any attempt to express the deepest self ., 在任何企图表达最深处的自我中隐含著挫折感.
yet i know she sees my deepest light ., 但我知道她看到我最深切的轻.

from the deepest ocean to the highest peak ., 从最深的海洋到最高的山峰.
北京顺成福机械设备有限公司 ... 锯片直径( Diameter of the saw) 最大切深( Deepest depth) 最大线速( Cutting speed).
中国之最，英文的... ... 最深的湖泊：贝加尔湖 Deepest lake:Lake Baikal 最大的平原：亚马孙平原 The Great Plains:Amazon.

entry.def: If something is deep, it extends a long way down from the ground or from the top surface of something.

example.ex: The water is very deep and mysterious-looking...
example.tran: 水看上去幽深叵测。

example.ex: Den had dug a deep hole in the centre of the garden...
example.tran: 德恩在花园的中央挖了一个深洞。

entry.def: A deep container, such as a cupboard, extends or measures a long distance from front to back.

example.ex: The wardrobe was very deep.
example.tran: 这个衣柜很深。

entry.def: You use deep to talk or ask about how much something measures from the surface to the bottom, or from front to back.

example.ex: I found myself in water only three feet deep...
example.tran: 我发现脚下的水只有 3 英尺深。

example.ex: The mud is ankle deep around Shush Square...
example.tran: 舒什广场周围的泥水深及脚踝。

entry.def: Deep in an area means a long way inside it

example.ex: They were now deep inside rebel territory.
example.tran: 他们现在已深入叛军占领区。

example.ex: ...deep inside the country...
example.tran: 深入该国的腹地

entry.tran: (足球、网球等运动中球)纵深的，靠近对方端线的
entry.def: In sports such as football and tennis, a deep shot or pass is one that sends the ball a long way towards the end of the pitch or court.

example.ex: ...Steve Staunton's deep cross.
example.tran: 史蒂夫·斯汤顿的纵深横传

example.ex: ...a deep volley.
example.tran: 凌空远射

entry.def: If you say that things or people are two ,three, or four deep, you mean that there are two, three, or four rows or layers of them there.

example.ex: A crowd three deep seemed paralysed by the images on these monitors...
example.tran: 里里外外三层的人群看到显示屏上的画面似乎全都惊呆了。

example.ex: The rest of the space was taken up by cardboard boxes piled right to the ceiling, ten deep.
example.tran: 其余的空间都被纸板盒子占据了，一直摞到天花板，足有 10 层高。

entry.tran: 严重的;深切的;深厚的;深深的
entry.def: You use deep to emphasize the seriousness, strength, importance, or degree of something.

example.ex: I had a deep admiration for Sartre...
example.tran: 我对萨特怀有深深的敬意。

example.ex: ...a period of deep personal crisis...
example.tran: 经历严重个人危机的一段时期

entry.def: If you experience or feel something deep inside you or deep down, you feel it very strongly even though you do not necessarily show it.

example.ex: I kept reassuring them but deep in my heart I knew we had no hope...
example.tran: 我一再安慰他们，但在内心深处我知道我们没有任何希望。

example.ex: Deep down, she supported her husband's involvement in the organization.
example.tran: 在心底里，她支持丈夫参加这个组织。

entry.def: If you are in a deep sleep, you are sleeping peacefully and it is difficult to wake you.

example.ex: Una soon fell into a deep sleep.
example.tran: 尤娜很快便沉沉睡去。

entry.tran: 沉浸在…中的;专注于…的;埋头于…的
entry.def: If you are deep in thought or deep in conversation, you are concentrating very hard on what you are thinking or saying and are not aware of the things that are happening around you.

example.ex: Abby had been so deep in thought that she had walked past her aunt's car without even seeing it...
example.tran: 阿比沉浸在自己的思绪中，以至于从她姨妈的车边经过时都没有注意到。

example.ex: Before long, we were deep in conversation.
example.tran: 没过多久，我们便聊得很起劲了。

entry.def: A deep look seems to see right into your mind.

example.ex: Peter gave him a long deep look.
example.tran: 彼得深邃的目光长久地注视着他。

entry.def: A deep breath or sigh uses or fills the whole of your lungs.

example.ex: Cal took a long, deep breath, struggling to control his own emotions...
example.tran: 卡尔深长地吸了一口气，努力控制自己的情绪。

example.ex: At last he gave a deep sigh.
example.tran: 最后他一声长叹。

entry.def: You use deep to describe colours that are strong and fairly dark.

example.ex: The sky was deep blue and starry...
example.tran: 天空一片深蓝色，其间星光闪烁。

example.ex: The tree has gnarled red branches and deep green leaves.
example.tran: 这棵树的树枝扭曲多瘤且呈红色，树叶则是深绿色。

entry.def: A deep sound is low in pitch.

example.ex: His voice was deep and mellow...
example.tran: 他的声音深沉而柔和。

example.ex: They heard a deep, distant roar.
example.tran: 他们听到远处传来一声低沉的怒吼。

entry.def: If you describe someone as deep, you mean that they are quiet and reserved in a way that makes you think that they have good qualities such as intelligence or determination.

example.ex: James is a very deep individual...
example.tran: 詹姆斯是一个非常内敛的人。

example.ex: That expressionless face had seemed deep and mysterious.
example.tran: 那张毫无表情的脸看上去深沉而又神秘。

entry.tran: (问题、文章等)重要的，严肃的，深刻的
entry.def: If you describe something such as a problem or a piece of writing as deep, you mean that it is important, serious, or complicated.

example.ex: This is a very deep question...
example.tran: 这是一个非常严肃的问题。

example.ex: They're written as adventure stories. They're not intended to be deep.
example.tran: 它们是作为历险故事来写的，并没打算追求深刻。

entry.def: If you are deep in debt, you have a lot of debts.

example.ex: He is so deep in debt and desperate for money that he's apparently willing to say anything...
example.tran: 他负债累累，急需要钱，很显然什么话都说得出来。

example.ex: The company is sliding even deeper into the red.
example.tran: 公司的亏损状况进一步恶化。

entry.def: The deep means the sea.

example.ex: ...a vast unfrequented pool, traversed by whales and creatures of the deep.
example.tran: 一个面积巨大、人迹罕至的水池，鲸和其他海洋动物穿游其间

entry.tran: 在内心深处，在心底（知道）
entry.def: If you know something deep down or deep down inside, you know that it is true, but you are not always conscious of it or willing to admit it to yourself.

example.ex: We knew deep down that we could do it...
example.tran: 在内心深处，我们知道自己能够做到。

example.ex: Deep down, we had always detested each other.
example.tran: 我们在心底里一直都讨厌彼此。

entry.tran: 深吸一口气(以使自己坚强自信)
entry.def: If you say that you took a deep breath before doing something dangerous or frightening, you mean that you tried to make yourself feel strong and confident.

example.ex: I took a deep breath and went in.
example.tran: 我深吸一口气，然后走了进去。

entry.tran: 非常严重;极为强烈;根深蒂固
entry.def: If you say that something goes deep or runs deep, you mean that it is very serious or strong and is hard to change.

example.ex: His anger and anguish clearly went deep...
example.tran: 他的愤怒和痛苦显然是深切而强烈的。

example.ex: The problems went deeper than mere teething difficulties.
example.tran: 问题不仅仅是起始阶段的小麻烦那么简单。

auth_sentence.content: I send my deepest condolences to Mark and Carol.
auth_sentence.res_content: I send my deepest condolences to Mark and Carol.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I send my deepest condolences to Mark and Carol.

auth_sentence.content: It is the deepest erupting volcano to be discovered.
auth_sentence.res_content: It is the deepest erupting volcano to be discovered.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It is the deepest erupting volcano to be discovered.

auth_sentence.content: Those French guys do it at the deepest part.
auth_sentence.res_content: Those French guys do it at the deepest part.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Those French guys do it at the deepest part.

Sentence.sentence: Strangely, it is this last quality that may have the deepest effect on the way people live.
